title: Reflected XSS via search query parameter in OWASP Juice Shop
vulnerability_information:
## Summary
The OWASP Juice Shop application is vulnerable to Reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) via the search functionality. User input in the search query is reflected directly in the DOM without proper sanitization.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Navigate to the Juice Shop application at http://localhost:3333
2. Click on the search icon in the top navigation bar
3. Enter the following payload in the search box: `<iframe src="javascript:alert('xss')">`
4. Submit the search query
5. Observe that the payload is reflected in the search results area and executes JavaScript

## Alternative PoC via URL
1. Navigate directly to: `http://localhost:3333/#/search?q=<iframe src="javascript:alert('xss')">`
2. The XSS payload executes in the browser context

## Impact
An attacker can craft a malicious URL containing a JavaScript payload in the search parameter. When a victim clicks the link, the JavaScript executes in their browser session, potentially allowing session hijacking, cookie theft, or phishing attacks.

## Expected Behavior
The search input should be properly sanitized and HTML-encoded before being rendered in the DOM.

## Actual Behavior
The search input is reflected into the page without encoding, allowing arbitrary HTML/JavaScript execution.
